Package Models

Class Diplomacy

java.lang.Object
Models.Diplomacy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Card, Order
public class Diplomacy extends Object implements Card, Serializable
Represents a Diplomacy card used in a game.

The Diplomacy card allows players to initiate negotiations and diplomacy with other players in the game. It handles the negotiation process between the granting player and the marked player.

Version:
3.0.0
Author:
Sumit Sharma, Muhammad Adnan Asad, Pranaykumar Chauhan, Darshansinh Dilipsinh Devda, Dhruvkumar Parmar, Dhruv Patel

      public Diplomacy(String p_markPlayer, Player p_grantingPlayer)
      Constructs a Diplomacy card with the specified marked player and granting player.
      Parameters:
      p_markPlayer - The player marked for diplomacy.
      p_grantingPlayer - The player granting the Diplomacy card.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute(GameState p_gameState)
      Executes the Diplomacy card order by initiating negotiations with the marked player. It updates the order execution log and game state accordingly.
      Specified by:
      execute in interface Order
      Parameters:
      p_gameState - The current game state.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid(GameState p_gameState)
      Checks the validity of the Diplomacy card order. It ensures that the marked player exists in the game.
      Specified by:
      isValid in interface Order
      Parameters:
      p_gameState - The current game state.
      Returns:
      True if the order is valid, false otherwise.

    • printOrder

      public void printOrder()
      Prints the Diplomacy order, showing the granting player and the marked player. This information is included in the order execution log.
      Specified by:
      printOrder in interface Order

    • setD_orderExecutionLog

      public void setD_orderExecutionLog(String p_orderExecutionLog, String p_logType)
      Sets the order execution log message for the Diplomacy card with the specified log type. Logs can be of type AppConstants.ERROR_LOG_MSG or "default."
      Specified by:
      setD_orderExecutionLog in interface Order
      Parameters:
      p_orderExecutionLog - The message to set as the order execution log.
      p_logType - The type of log, either AppConstants.ERROR_LOG_MSG or "default."

    • getOrderName

      public String getOrderName()
      Retrieves the name of the Diplomacy card order.
      Specified by:
      getOrderName in interface Order
      Returns:
